decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle using Spirit creatures. The key strategy involves utilizing cards like Rattlechains and Skyclave Apparition to control the board while creatures like Supreme Phantom and Spell Queller provide additional damage and disruption. The deck also includes ways to protect its creatures and counter opponent's spells, ensuring consistent pressure on the opponent throughout the game. By maintaining a strong board presence and using efficient spells, the deck aims to quickly outpace the opponent and secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the combo between Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II to create a powerful synergy that can quickly overwhelm opponents. The deck is designed to control the board with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while also protecting key pieces with Seasoned Hallowblade and Guardian of New Benalia. The inclusion of Monument to Endurance helps to increase the longevity of the combo, while cards like Vanishing Verse provide additional removal options. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently execute its combo strategy and outpace opponents in a 1 vs 1 format.

The main focus of the deck is to aggressively play creatures and spells in order to deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. It utilizes efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, along with burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to control the board and put pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to be fast-paced and proactive, overwhelming the opponent with a steady stream of threats and direct damage. The mana base is built to support the aggressive game plan, with a mix of dual lands and basic lands to ensure consistent and fast mana development.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage while utilizing the companion Kaheera, the Orphanguard for additional value. The deck focuses on maintaining board control and disrupting the opponent's game plan with various spells like Dovin's Veto, Settle the Wreckage, and Supreme Verdict. Cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria provide card advantage and further disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes some win conditions like Elspeth, Storm Slayer and The Wandering Emperor to close out the game.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly cycle through your deck to get Arclight Phoenixes into the graveyard, then bring them back onto the battlefield for repeated aggressive attacks. By using cards like Lightning Axe, Picklock Prankster, and Treasure Cruise, you can fill your graveyard with Phoenixes and other key spells. The deck also includes cards like Sleight of Hand and Opt to help draw into your combo pieces faster. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficiently getting Arclight Phoenixes back from the graveyard to overwhelm your opponent with a fast-paced assault.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly getting creatures onto the battlefield and applying pressure to the opponent. It includes a mix of low-cost creatures and removal spells to control the board and keep the opponent on the back foot. The deck utilizes powerful cards like Bloodtithe Harvester and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to maintain board presence and close out games quickly. By combining aggressive creatures with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

This aggro Rakdos deck focuses on early disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress, while also utilizing efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to control the board. The deck aims to apply pressure with aggressive creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Graveyard Trespasser, while also utilizing Mutavault and other versatile lands to provide additional threats. The inclusion of powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker allows the deck to close out games quickly and decisively.

This UW Control deck focuses on countering and controlling the opponent's threats while gaining card advantage and tempo through cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck also utilizes board wipes like Supreme Verdict and removal like Dovin's Veto to maintain control of the game. The inclusion of the companion Kaheera, the Orphanguard provides additional value and synergy with the deck's creatures. Overall, the strategy revolves around disrupting the opponent's game plan and outlasting them with powerful late-game threats like Elspeth, Sun's Champion.

The main concept of this deck is to play aggressively and quickly overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to deal damage early and often, utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage alongside spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage. The mana base is designed to support a fast start, with cards like Copperline Gorge and Stomping Ground providing the necessary colors of mana. Overall, the deck focuses on maintaining pressure and finishing the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing the synergy between Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II to create a powerful combo that can quickly overwhelm the opponent. By mixing in support cards like Fleeting Spirit and Monument to Endurance, the deck aims to protect its key pieces and maintain control of the battlefield. Thoughtseize and Fatal Push provide disruption against opposing strategies, while Lively Dirge and Sheltered by Ghosts offer additional protection for the combo. The deck's mana base is carefully constructed to support its key cards and ensure consistency in executing the combo.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly equipping creatures with powerful artifacts like Colossus Hammer and Dragonfire Blade to deal massive damage to the opponent. By utilizing cards like Sigarda's Aid and Kemba, Kha Enduring, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient equipment. The inclusion of cards like Portable Hole and Sheltered by Ghosts provide additional support and removal options, while Mox Amber helps ramp up mana for faster plays. With a mix of creatures and equipment, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in fast-paced matches.

This deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy utilizing low-cost creatures and disruption spells to control the game. By combining powerful threats like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Floodpits Drowner with efficient removal like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent before they can establish a strong board presence. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Thoughtseize and Spell Pierce allows for disruption and protection against opposing game plans. The deck's land base is also optimized for consistent mana production to ensure smooth gameplay.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures, backed up by direct damage spells and combat tricks. The deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent early in the game and finishing them off quickly before they have a chance to stabilize. By combining efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage with burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage, the deck aims to be a consistent and powerful aggro threat in the Pioneer format.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying efficient creatures to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Archon of Emeria and Elite Spellbinder. Collected Company serves as a powerful card advantage engine, helping to refill the board with more threats. The mana base is optimized for consistent access to both green and white mana sources, ensuring that the deck can deploy its aggressive threats early and often. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of creatures while disrupting their strategy.

The Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with high-powered creatures and disruptive spells. It utilizes cards like Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, and Duress to control the opponent's resources while efficiently dealing damage with creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The deck aims to apply pressure early and keep the opponent on the back foot by combining aggressive threats with targeted removal. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance to provide card advantage and additional reach.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays and disruption, using efficient removal like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to control the board. It also includes hand disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress. The deck aims to capitalize on opponents discarding cards with cards like Waste Not and benefiting from it with cards like Tinybones, Bauble Burglar. It also has powerful late game threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to close out games. The mana base is built to support Black mana requirements and to disrupt opponent's lands with cards like Field of Ruin.
